result.execSummary:
All charges against Shane Roger Marx in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shane Roger Marx is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shane Roger Marx not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's Motion to Revoke Bond.  Terri Pixley appears in person. Bond posted by Terri Pixley to assure he appears for court and complies with bond conditions.  State requests if bond forfeited $800 of it go the Pepin County Sheriff's Dept. for previous extradition costs.  Court exercises discretion and orders $2500 be forfeited to county general fund with $2500 retd.  Sheriff will have to go to the County Board for the money.

Defendant Shane Roger Marx in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Shane Roger Marx in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State intends to amend Information to include repeater.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Notice given.
Amended Information

Defendant Shane Roger Marx in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Shane Roger Marx in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Atty Waters requests bond be modified to zero or request the court consider a furlough to assist his parents in moving.  Court orders bond remain as previously set.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Notice provided to counsel.
Atty Patrick Waters appt'd. 3/19/15.
Defendant Shane Roger Marx in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Shane Roger Marx in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Shane Roger Marx in court with attorney Patrick Waters.  Defendant Shane Roger Marx in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to P.H.  Waiver form filed.  Court finds defendant's waiver of P.H. done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA to file Information.  Atty Waters requests bond be modified to $1000 cash bond.  Defendant currently serving jail on Pierce County case until May 11th.  Court orders bond remain as set.  Arraignment set for April 7, 2015 at 2:30 p.m.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shane Roger Marx in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights and right to preliminary hearing.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets $5000 cash bond.  Waiver of time limits for P.H., matter cont'd to Tues., 3/17/15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
